review_title: Good team and manager, little upwards mobility
job_title: Research Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: My manager was fantastic! Very supportive and made sure we understood our tasks well.
cons: Very hard to move up in the company. Upper management is poor, executives seem disconnected with lower levels of the company.

job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Great fresh out of college. Quick way to gain experience and they just went public.
cons: Contractor period after initial hire

job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Support from leads and superiors. Lots of on the clock team-building activities, monthly food trucks and frequent company updates.
cons: Have to commute between work locations as the main location is not large enough to accommodate all employees. Lots of new projects to take on and takes some time to hire staff to support those projects

review_title: Great place to get your foot in the door with biotech or horticulture.
pros: Nice facilities, intelligent and hardworking staff, growing company.
cons: Historically underpaid, but that was recently improved. Lack of inter department alignment. Overwhelming project load which leads to cutting corners and poor results. Emphasis on getting things done quickly, not always properly.

job_title: Sr. Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Great culture and plenty of opportunities
cons: There is no 401 k match yet.

pros: nice environment good job trail
cons: hard to move up from contractor

review_title: kind people with a valiant and cool mission but hopelessly disorganized and no sense of urgency
pros: the people are nice and the work is relatively predictable and mundane
cons: the week-to-week structure is really chaotic and no one really has a firm handle on the situation or wants to accept accountability

pros:
-mindful management
-respectful of time off.
cons: Not the most transparent when it comes to career development.

job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Everyone is kind, caring, and strive for a very cooperative environment between departments.
cons: The current transition seems all over the place, but it does open to more opportunities.

review_title: Great environment, lots of opportunity for professional growth
pros:
Flexible role buildable to interests
Supportive management
Challenging work
cons: At times, role can lack definition

review_title: Great if you're fresh out of college
job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Learned a lot in plant science, great experience for people new to plant biology field and want experience in either lab or greenhouse work. Provide benefits and 401 k.
cons: Terrible for wages, seem to be lacking mentors for their employees, not a lot of opportunity to advance. Managers and directors need improvement, they are generally disconnected.

pros: It’s a company that has money sometimes.
cons: Not very strong in the leadership department.

job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Great Place for Recent Graduates, allows for immediate hands on experience. Very small company that allows for personal input and responsibilities.
cons: Not a lot of experienced workers, a lot of issues are made without their being any forethought taken into account.

review_title: Great place to gain experience, but career (and salary) will stagnate
pros: Great culture to be a part of. People are super nice. Tons of groups and committees to be a part of. Opportunity for industry experience. Great for entry-level positions.
cons: Poor management. Not a lot of opportunity to grow or learn. Seems you're constantly fighting with supervisors: no trust, micro-manage, hypocritical and hardly any appreciation. Depending on which department you're in (and the supervisor)  work/life balance may not be taken into consideration.

pros: Great work experience for those who are interested in biotechnology.
cons: Poor management. Micro managing, verbal abuse from leadership, and no opportunities to move up in the company. There is very little concern and protection of the health of coworkers who are exposed to toxic chemicals that are known to cause cancer.

job_title: Greenhouse Assistant II in San Diego, CA
pros: I had great co-workers, I learned a lot from working there. The CEO was always available to ask questions to, and he would ask questions in return. No one acted more important than the next. It was a great work environment.
cons: Not a lot of accountability held for bad behavior/performance.

pros: Some friendly staff, frequent casual social gatherings, nice new building.
cons: Entitled scientists, rampant nepotism and below-market compensation. Disorganized management and poor PTO/family leave.

job_title: Research Scientist in San Diego, CA
pros: Great team of people, pretty good resources, and Bioinformatics team leader is fantastic
cons: sometime unclear leadership and directions.  communication is not very efficient in group and outside of group.

job_title: Research Associate in San Diego, CA
pros: Great small biotechnology company that values professional development. Maintains vision and fosters a positive company culture. Good benefits.
cons: Different performance expectations across projects. Get lucky and land a good manager. Below-market offers.

review_title: Nice work environment with great campus
pros: Employee culture is put as a top priority with multiple employee groups leading the effort. Work is rewarding and coworkers are very nice to work with.
cons: Pay is below industry average.

review_title: Very nice people to work with.
job_title: Research Assistant in San Diego, CA
pros: Great work flexibility and able to learn new things from other departments.
cons: Takes a long time to get promoted or move up to a position of interest.

pros: Positive work environment, great benefits for the size of company, good core values. Company gym onsite, beautiful building to work in.
cons: Some growing pains but everything good

pros: Co-workers and supervisors were great to work with.
cons: Stuck at an intern position

pros: Nice working place and talented people
cons: better health benefits with better retirement plans

pros: Great coworkers and interesting projects.
cons: Typical growing pains of an expanding company.
